alert.note: Alert for Stewart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 5:06PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Stewart County through 530 PM EST... At 506 PM EST, a strong thunderstorm was over Sanford, or 10 miles southwest of Lumpkin, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Richland, Troutman, Charles, Sanford, Westville, Brooklyn, Louvale and Providence Canyon State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
